Description:
Compares identifying information and counts items of outgoing shipments to verify information against sales orders or other records
Affixes shipping labels on packed cartons and write and/or stamps identifying shipping information on cartons
Schedule and process International shipments, including bill of lading and NAFTA documentation
Pick/pack using scanner including trade show orders
Operates forklift truck, cherry picker or uses pallet jack to move, or transport products from/to storage or work area
Create a constant pipeline of new materials and technologies that will be of interest to ThinkLAB clients and team
Identify root cause and supply possible solutions
Assist the Materials Manager in all phases of inventory managementSkills
Skills:
Must be able to operate all other pieces of equipment within the department safely and efficiently
Communication skills.
Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment.
Team Orientation & Interpersonal – highly motivated team player with ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with all levels within and external to the organization.
Adaptability to Change – able to be flexible and supportive, react swiftly to and able to positively and proactively assimilate change in rapid growth environment.
Multi-task - Ability to expeditiously organize, coordinate, manage, prioritize, and perform multiple tasks simultaneously to swiftly assess a situation, determine a logical course of action, and apply the appropriate response.
Organization & Time Management – able to plan, schedule, organize and follow up on tasks related to job to achieve goals within or ahead of established time frames.
Relationship Management – able to personally provide high level of interactive service to others, building relationships and addressing identified needs.
Min GPA 3/4 & 3.75/5
3+ years of proven experience.
